Benchmark Multiple Learners on Multiple Tasks

Source: R/benchmark.R

Runs a benchmark of the cross-product of learners, tasks, and resampling strategies (possibly in parallel).

benchmark(tasks, learners, resamplings, measures = NULL, ctrl = list())

Arguments

tasks

(list of Task):
List of objects of type Task.
learners

(list of Learner):
List of objects of type Learner.
resamplings

(list of Resampling):
List of objects of type Resampling.
measures

(list of Measure):
List of performance measures used to assess the predictive performance. Defaults to the respective measures stored in task.
ctrl

(named list as returned by mlr_control()):
Object to control experiment execution. See mlr_control().

Value

BenchmarkResult.

Examples

tasks = mlr_tasks$mget(c("iris", "sonar"))
learners = mlr_learners$mget(c("classif.featureless", "classif.rpart"))
resamplings = mlr_resamplings$mget(c("holdout", "cv"))
measures = mlr_measures$mget("acc")
bmr = benchmark(tasks, learners, resamplings, measures)

# performance for all conducted experiments
head(as.data.table(bmr))
#>                hash          task task_id                     learner
#> 1: d655caad12795ce3 <TaskClassif>    iris <LearnerClassifFeatureless>
#> 2: 0213798e918b2c45 <TaskClassif>    iris       <LearnerClassifRpart>
#> 3: 593e62e60f69bdeb <TaskClassif>    iris <LearnerClassifFeatureless>
#> 4: 794ecedc1344f8b3 <TaskClassif>    iris       <LearnerClassifRpart>
#> 5: 593e62e60f69bdeb <TaskClassif>    iris <LearnerClassifFeatureless>
#> 6: 794ecedc1344f8b3 <TaskClassif>    iris       <LearnerClassifRpart>
#>             learner_id          resampling resampling_id       acc
#> 1: classif.featureless <ResamplingHoldout>       holdout 0.2800000
#> 2:       classif.rpart <ResamplingHoldout>       holdout 0.9200000
#> 3: classif.featureless      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.2000000
#> 4:       classif.rpart      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.8666667
#> 5: classif.featureless      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.2666667
#> 6:       classif.rpart      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.8666667

# aggregated performance values
bmr$aggregated
#>                hash  resample_result task_id          learner_id resampling_id
#> 1: d655caad12795ce3 <ResampleResult>    iris classif.featureless       holdout
#> 2: 0213798e918b2c45 <ResampleResult>    iris       classif.rpart       holdout
#> 3: 593e62e60f69bdeb <ResampleResult>    iris classif.featureless            cv
#> 4: 794ecedc1344f8b3 <ResampleResult>    iris       classif.rpart            cv
#> 5: e22d6e02bdd61264 <ResampleResult>   sonar classif.featureless       holdout
#> 6: 52d157add46848de <ResampleResult>   sonar       classif.rpart       holdout
#> 7: 28fc02c3eb1f80d5 <ResampleResult>   sonar classif.featureless            cv
#> 8: 8e809262faec8242 <ResampleResult>   sonar       classif.rpart            cv
#>          acc
#> 1: 0.2800000
#> 2: 0.9200000
#> 3: 0.1933333
#> 4: 0.9333333
#> 5: 0.5507246
#> 6: 0.7536232
#> 7: 0.5347619
#> 8: 0.7209524

# Overview of of resamplings that were conducted internally
rrs = bmr$resample_results
print(rrs)
#>                hash task_id          learner_id resampling_id  N
#> 1: d655caad12795ce3    iris classif.featureless       holdout  1
#> 2: 0213798e918b2c45    iris       classif.rpart       holdout  1
#> 3: 593e62e60f69bdeb    iris classif.featureless            cv 10
#> 4: 794ecedc1344f8b3    iris       classif.rpart            cv 10
#> 5: e22d6e02bdd61264   sonar classif.featureless       holdout  1
#> 6: 52d157add46848de   sonar       classif.rpart       holdout  1
#> 7: 28fc02c3eb1f80d5   sonar classif.featureless            cv 10
#> 8: 8e809262faec8242   sonar       classif.rpart            cv 10

# Extract first ResampleResult
rr = bmr$resample_result(hash = rrs$hash[1])
print(rr)
#> ResampleResult of learner 'iris' on task 'classif.featureless' with 1 iterations
#>  Measure Min. 1st Qu. Median Mean 3rd Qu. Max. Sd
#>      acc 0.28    0.28   0.28 0.28    0.28 0.28 NA

# Extract predictions of first experiment of this resampling
head(as.data.table(rr$experiment(1)$prediction))
#>    row_id response  truth
#> 1:      2   setosa setosa
#> 2:      4   setosa setosa
#> 3:     10   setosa setosa
#> 4:     13   setosa setosa
#> 5:     19   setosa setosa
#> 6:     21   setosa setosa
